action.action-desc: Mr. Babin introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title 31, United States Code, to authorize transportation for Government astronauts returning from space between their residence and various locations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Astronaut Safe Temporary Ride Options Act or the ASTRO Act.

section.header: Transportation of astronauts returning from space

subsection.text: Section 1344(a)(2) of title 31, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking or at the end;
in subparagraph (B), by inserting or after the comma at the end; and
by inserting before the matter following subparagraph (B) the following:

subparagraph.text: necessary for post-flight transportation of Government astronauts, and others subject to reimbursable arrangements, returning from space for the performance of medical research, monitoring, diagnosis, or treatment, or other official duties, prior to receiving post-flight medical clearance to operate a motor vehicle,

paragraph.text: Not later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act and annually thereafter, the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration shall submit an annual report to Congress on the use of the authority providing transportation under subparagraph (C) of section 1344(a)(2) of title 31, United States Code (as added by subsection (a) of this Act).

Any such report shall include the name of any individual who received such transportation, the number of instances such transportation was provided, and the total cost of such transportation for the year preceding the date such report is submitted.
